{{Marvel Database:Team Template | Image = Apocalypse Twins (Earth-616) from Uncanny Avengers Vol 1 7 0001.jpg | Title = | Name = Apocalypse Twins | Aliases = Heirs of Archangel{{r|Uncanny Avengers #7}} | Status = Defunct | Identity = Secret | Reality = Earth-616 | BaseOfOperations = Mobile | CurrentMembers = | FormerMembers = [[Uriel (Mutant) (Earth-616)|Uriel]], [[Eimin (Earth-616)|Eimin]] | Allies = [[Ichisumi (Earth-616)|Ichisumi]], [[Horsemen of Apocalypse (Earth-616)|Horsemen of Death]], formerly [[Nathaniel Richards (Kang) (Earth-6311)|Kang]] | Enemies = [[Avengers Unity Division (Earth-616)|Avengers Unity Division]], [[Nathaniel Richards (Kang) (Earth-6311)|Kang]] | Origin = The twin heirs of [[Warren Worthington III (Earth-616)|Archangel]], taken by [[Nathaniel Richards (Kang) (Earth-6311)|Kang]] to the future. | PlaceOfFormation = [[Akkaba City]], [[North Pole]] | PlaceOfDissolution = [[Sahara Desert]], [[Africa]] | Creators = Rick Remender; Olivier Coipel | First = Uncanny Avengers #5 | Last = Uncanny Avengers #22 | HistoryText = During the [[Dark Angel Saga]], the [[Horsemen of Apocalypse (Earth-616)|Horseman of Pestilence]] [[Ichisumi (Earth-616)|Ichisumi]] became pregnant with [[Warren Worthington III (Earth-616)|Archangel]]'s heirs.{{r|Uncanny X-Force #18}} Some time after his defeat at the hands of [[X-Force (Strike Team) (Earth-616)|X-Force]], Ichisumi gave birth to the twins [[Uriel (Mutant) (Earth-616)|Uriel]] and [[Eimin (Earth-616)|Eimin]]. Soon afterwards [[Nathaniel Richards (Kang) (Earth-6311)|Kang the Conqueror]] kidnapped them and disappeared into the time stream.{{r|Uncanny Avengers #5}} The Twins reappeared in the modern era, when [[William Rolfson (Earth-616)|Genocide]], son of [[En Sabah Nur (Earth-616)|Apocalypse]], contacted a [[Celestials|Celestial Gardener]]. He hoped to receive the [[Death Seed]] and replace Apocalypse as Archangel had. As the Gardener judged his worth, Uriel and Eimin appeared. Using the axe [[Jarnbjorn]], Uriel killed the Celestial. Together, he and Eimin defeated Genocide's forces. They then attacked [[Peak VII|the Peak]]. {{r|Uncanny Avengers #7}} They next travelled with [[Thor Odinson (Earth-616)|Thor]] and [[Shiro Yoshida (Earth-616)|Sunfire]] to Akkaba City to murder the remainder of [[Clan Akkaba (Earth-616)|Clan Akkaba]] and destroy the city.{{r|Uncanny Avengers #8}} ===Ragnarok Now=== Using the [[Jarnbjorn]], the Twins killed a Celestial{{r|Uncanny Avengers Vol 1 9}} and incriminated the Earth for said crime. Thus, [[Exitar (Earth-616)|Exitar the Executioner]] would arrive to the planet in order to destroy it.{{r|Uncanny Avengers Vol 1 15}} The Apocalypse Twins convinced the [[Wanda Maximoff (Earth-616)|Scarlet Witch]] to cast a spell in order to bring every mutant to their ark, in order to ensure the survival of mutantkind while humankind died along with Earth.{{r|Uncanny Avengers Vol 1 14}} In a divergent universe, their plan would have succeeded. But from said universe, the remaining of the Avengers Unity Division arrived and thwarted the Twin's plans.{{r|Uncanny Avengers Vol 1 20}} Exitar was killed, and Kang fed from his energies to become a powerful being.{{r|Uncanny Avengers Vol 1 21}} As Havok was fighting Kang, Sunfire used part of the absorbed energy of the Celestial to destroy the Apocalypse Twins and their ark. Daken and Grim Reaper, the two remaining [[Horsemen of Apocalypse (Earth-616)|Horsemen of Death]] under the service of the Twins, managed to get back to Earth along with the Twin's corpses.{{r|Uncanny Avengers Vol 1 22}} | Equipment = [[Life Seed]]
[[Death Seed]] | Transportation = The Ark | Weapons = [[Jarnbjorn]] | Notes = | Trivia = | Links = }} [[Category:Twins]]
